resources.string: Mostrar notificación en la barra de estado
Muestra el perfil activo con indicador de preferencias. Abre el activador al pulsar..
Lanzar desde la pantalla de inicio
Iniciar el evento a pesar de que ha activado manualmente el perfil
La desinstalación de PPHelper necesita ROOT
¡No se han configurado todos los parámetros subrayados!
pausar evento - activar y deshacer perfil
Mostrar en la barra de estado
Mostrar en barra de estado y pantalla de bloqueo
pausar evento - activar y reiniciar eventos
Desvincular vols. de llamadas y notif.
Si cambias el color del icono, en la barra de estado será blanco. Si eliges un icono personalizado, en la barra de estado se verá el icono de la aplicación.
Haz clic aquí para ver información importante

El evento no se inicia cuando:
1. Has deshabilitado la ejecución global de eventos ("semáforo" en rojo) - actívalo desde el menú del Editor en la opción "Activar ejecución de eventos".
2. Has activado manualmente el perfil ("semáforo" en ámbar) - debes reiniciar los eventos. Usa el icono de Reiniciar eventos en el título del Activador, Editor o en la notificación. Un perfil activado manualmente se indica también con "[M]" delante del nombre del perfil. Excepto cuando en el evento se ha activado la opción "Ignorar activación automática".
3. Has deshabilitado la ejecución de eventos desde las preferencias de evento - la opción de evento "Ejecutar eventos" debe estar marcada.
 Nota: El "Semáforo" está en el título del Activador y en el Editor.
Algunas preferencias de perfil necesitan acceso de ROOT. Estas preferencias están marcadas con \"(R)\".
Puedes usar comodines: \"%\"=cualesquiera caracteres, \"_\"=cualquier carácter único.

Cuando tienes un dispositivo Sony y activas el modo \"Stamina\" en \"Administración de energía\", por favor, añade a PhoneProfiles en \"Apps activas en modo de espera\". Si no haces esto, la aplicación no funcionará correctamente.
Algunas preferencias del perfil requieren cambios en los Ajustes del sistema. Estas preferencias están marcadas \"(S)\".
Permitia que PhoneProfiles tenga \"acceso a las notificaciones\" en los ajustes del sistema, para habilitar el \"Tipo de Interrupción\" en el perfil de preferencia.
\"Interrupciones\" en el perfil \"Modo Timbre\" requiere habilitar \"Acceso a las notificaciones\" a PhoneProfiles enblos ajustes del sistema. Presione aqui y habilite PhoneProfiles.
To enable Notification parameters, allow PhoneProfiles \"Notification access\" in system settings.
Por favor autorízalos en los diálogos siguientes. Después el perfil de activará.
requiere que se autoricen algunos permisos.
La instalación del tono \"PhoneProfiles Silent\" no se ejecutará porque requiere permisos.
Por favor, concédalos en las siguientes pantallas. Después se instalará el tono.
La instalación del tono \"PhoneProfiles Silent\" requiere permisos.
Elegir el fondo de pantalla necesita algunos permisos.
Por favor, concédelos en las ventanas siguientes. Luego podrás elegir un fondo de pantalla de la galería.
La selección del icono de perfil personalizado requiere permisos.
Por favor, concédelos en las ventanas siguientes. Luego podrás elegir un icono de la galería.
Backup of application settings requires some permissions.
Please grant them in next dialog. Settings will then be backed-up.
Restore of application settings requires some permissions.
Please grant them in next dialog. Data will then be restored.
No ha activado \"Modificar ajustes de sistema\". ¿No preguntarlo de nuevo?
Por favor, busque la aplicación \"PhoneProfilePlus\" y actívela.
Por favor, active los permisos en la opción \"Permisos\".
Por favor, concédalos en las siguientes pantallas. Después se reiniciarán los eventos.
Por favor, concédalos en las siguientes pantallas. Después se activará la detección.
Obtener la lista de calendario requiere algunos permisos.
Por favor, acéptalos en las pantallas siguientes. Después se mostrará la lista de calendario.
Obtener la lista de contactos requiere algunos permisos.
Por favor, acéptalos en las pantallas siguientes. Después se mostrará la lista de contactos.
Por favor activa la localización y el escaneo Wi-Fi en ajustes de sistema. Sin esto, el escaneo Wi-Fi no funcionará.
Por favor activa la localización y el escaneo Bluetooth en ajustes de sistema. Sin esto, el escaneo Bluetooth no funcionará.
Escáner Wi-Fi en modo Ahorro de Energia
Escáner Bluetooth en modo Ahorro de Energia
Ajustes del modo de ahorro de energía
En Android 6 (Marshmallow), no es posible cambiar el ajuste de sistema \"Vibrar al sonar\" en un dispositivo no rooteado.
En Android 6 (Marshmallow) no es posible cambiar el nivel de \"Brillo adaptativo\" en dispositivos no \'rooteados\'.
En Android 6 (Marshmallow) para la detección de Wi-Fi debe estar activada Ubicación y \"Detección de Wi-fi\" en Ajustes de ubicación.
En Android 6 (Marshmallow) para la detección de Bluetooth debe estar activada la Ubicación y la \"Detección de Wi-fi\" en el menu de Ubicación.
Permitir que PhoneProfiles detecte qué aplicación está en primer plano. Esto es necesario para eventos con \"parámetros de aplicaciones\".
Permitir PhoneProfiles en el menú de \"Accesibilidad\", para activar parámetros de aplicaciones.
Para cambiar el nivel adaptativo, es necesario Root.
El perfil se puede activar de dos formas:
1. Manual activation - activated in Activator, Editor, notification, widget, shortcut. Manually activated profiles are indicated with \"[M]\" in front of the profile name.
La activación manual pausa todos los eventos y éstos nunca serán iniciados. Debes Reiniciar los eventos para hacer que se inicien.
Exception to this rule applies when you set the \"Ignore manual activation\" preference.
Reiniciar eventos puede ser invocado desde Activador, Editor y Notificación.
En el título del activador y del Editor es un \"semáforo\".
- color verde: los eventos pueden ser iniciados.
-color naranja: no se pueden iniciar eventos - perfil es activado manualmente.
-color rojo: eventos parados - los eventos pueden activarse desde el botón \"Activar eventos\" del menú editor.

Android 6+ implements \"Doze mode\" and \"App Standby\". Concerning problems with event profile activation, if you leave the device unplugged and stationary for a period of time with the screen off, add PhoneProfiles into \"Battery\"→\"Battery optimization\"→\"Not optimized\".
En Android 6 este ajuste de sistema sólo se puede cambiar en dispositivos rooteados. Actúa sobre los modos de timbre y los tipos de interrupción con vibración.
Este evento puede estar en 5 estados:
Running: event is started and running. Event parameters are satisfied.
Pausa: evento no se está ejecutando. No se cumplen los parámetros de evento. El Evento espera la satisfacción de los parámetros.
Stopped: event is stopped and cannot be started. Event parameter \"Enable run\" is not checked.
Paused with delay: event is started, but is waiting for the delay to expire. Event parameters are satisfied.
When no events are running, the \"Default profile\" is enabled if configured. You can configure a default profile in application settings in \"Profile activation\". Click here to configure it.
If your device does not have separate volumes for ringtone and notifications, keep volume separation enabled.

How \"volume separation\" works: Profile activation adjusts device volume by the running profile notifications volume level. When call ringing is detected, the ringing volume level from the running profile is adjusted. After the call ends, the notification volume level from the running profile is restored.
No se puede borrar, localización usada en otro evento.
Por favor, acéptalos en las pantallas siguientes. Después se activará la detección de cambio de localización.
Error de Servicios de Google Play
Error al conectar a los Servicios de Google Play. Haz clic aquí para resolverlo.
Setup location parameters in application settings.
Escaneado de localización en modo de Ahorro de Batería
Please enable Location in System Settings. Without this, location scanning will not work.
Use GPS when not in Power Save mode
Please grant them in next dialog.
Running with delay: event is running, but parameters are not satisfied. Event is waiting for the delay to expire.
Experimental. It may not work on your device
To enable \"Ignore for applications\" parameter, allow PhoneProfiles \"Accessibility\" in system settings.
Setup Wi-Fi parameters in application settings.
Setup Bluetooth parameters in application settings.
Orientation scan in Power Save mode
Setup Orientation parameters in application settings.
If option \"24 hours\" is not working on your device (LG), use option \"Always On\". Option \"Always On\" may cause problems with Samsung devices. If so, then use option \"24 hours\".
You have selected a ringer/notification tone from the SDCard. Tone cannot be played because this requires some permissions.
Please grant them in next dialog. Tone will then be played.
Playing selected ringer/notification requires some permissions to be granted.
This important information can be viewed In Editor through the question mark icon in the toolbar.
Some profile preferences are interactive. These preferences display system setup screens, and are marked with \"(I)\".
Note: Orange text in this information is clickable. Clicking on this text opens the relevant setup screen.
Event run is not enabled. Enable it?
Please rate this application on Google Play
Application uses languages configured in system.
You have not enabled \"Do not disturb access\". Never ask again?
Please search for \"PhoneProfiles\" application and enable it.
Add PhoneProfiles to \"Not optimized\" if you encounter problems with event profile activation, or if you leave your device unplugged and stationary for a period of time with the screen off.
Mobile cell scanning requires some permissions.
Setup Mobile cell parameters in application settings.
Mobile cell scan in Power Save mode
All Bluetooth names configured in system
4. Each event has \"Priority\". Event will not start if a currently running event has a higher priority value.
Events are running in \"Start order\". You can modify the start order in Editor in events view \"Start order\", where you can drag events up/down by the \"order handler\".
You can activate a profile through Tasker. Configure task \"System\"/\"Send Intent\" with parameters:
You can manage events through Tasker. Configure task \"System\"/\"Send Intent\" with parameters:
You must write a tag name into the NFC tag. \"Write to NFC Tag\" is in the menu for each tag name.
Attach your device to an NFC tag. Write will be started.
NFC must be enabled. Please enable it and try again.
Pause event after manual profile activation and then restart events
Do you find this application useful?\nSupport its development by sending a donation to the developer.
In-App Donations are not supported. Is Google Play Store installed correctly?
Thank you for donating.\nI really appreciate it.
You have not enabled \"Draw over apps\". Never ask again?
Please search for \"PhoneProfiles\" application and enable it.
For Huawei devices, please enable protection of PhoneProfiles in \"Advanced settings\"→\"Battery manager\"→\"Protected apps\". Without this, the app will not work properly.

For Xiaomi devices, please set \"No restrictions\" for PhoneProfiles in \"Settings\"→\"Battery & performance\"→\"Manager apps battery usage\"→\"Choose apps\". Without this, the app will not work properly.
For Samsung devices, please turn off \"App power saving\" for PhoneProfiles in \"Settings\"→\"Battery\"→\"App power saving\"→\"Detail\". Without this, the app will not work properly.
You can set each profile parameter to use Shared profile. Click here to configure the Shared profile parameters.
For more information look at \"Important information\" (question mark icon in Editor bottom toolbar).
This important information can be viewed In Editor through the question mark icon in the bottom toolbar.
unsupported network type or can\'t be changed

Event will start only when all \"Enable sensor\" checked sensor parameters are fulfilled. Running event will end if some checked sensor parameters are not fulfilled. Check only those sensors you need for this event. Checked sensor name is marked with bold text.\n\nSome sensor parameters are needed. Needed parameter names are marked with underlined text. If some needed parameters are not configured, event will not start, and parameter \"Enable sensor\" will be unchecked.
Some devices do not support colorful icons in the status bar.
For truly silent notification volume, configure notification tone to \"PhoneProfiles Silent\".
Notification tone \"PhoneProfiles Silent\" is not installed. Please install it from Editor menu and try again.
Your device has linked volume levels for ringtone and notifications. You can use \"Unlink ringer and notification volumes\". Click here to configure it.
Your device has linked volumes for ringtone and notifications. If you want unlinked volumes, check this parameter.
Enable usage of parameter \"Priority\" in application settings.
If ringtone volume is set to \"0\", it configures the device for silent mode. Notification volume is ignored.

Ongoing status bar notification is required for PhoneProfilesService to operate properly. With notification, PhoneProfilesService is changed to \"foreground service,\" which is not killed by Android. PhoneProfilesService must run permanently.
Priority functionality: Event will not start if another running event has a higher priority level.
Bluetooth types: [CL] classic, [LE] low energy, [DU] dual.
This sensor will start an event by time. Parameters: Start time, End time, Days of week.
This sensor will start an event by calendar event. Parameters: Calendars, Search field (Event name, Description, etc.), Search string, Ignore \"All day\" events, Availability (Busy, Free, etc.).
This sensor will start an event by battery level. Parameters: Low level, Upper level, Charging, Power save mode.
This sensor will start an event by calling contacts. Parameters: Call event (Ringing, Outgoing call started, etc.), Contact groups, Contacts, Contact list type (white/black list).
This sensor will start an event by received SMS/MMS from contacts. Parameters: Contact groups, Contacts, Contact list type (white/black list), Permanent run, Duration (event run duration).
This sensor will start an event by device location. Parameters: Location, Start when outside location.
This sensor will start an event by Wi-Fi SSID. Parameters: Connection Type (Nearby, Connected, etc.), SSID.
This sensor will start an event by Bluetooth name. Parameters: Connection Type (Nearby, Connected, etc.), Scanned device type (Classic, Low energy, etc.), Bluetooth name.
This sensor will start an event by connected mobile cells (towers). Parameters: Cells, Start when outside cells.
This sensor will start an event by connected accessory (car dock, hands-free, headphones, etc.). Parameters: Accessories type.
This sensor will start an event by screen on/off. Parameters: Event type (screen on, screen off, etc.), End when unlocked (event ends when device unlocked).
This sensor will start an event by notification from applications. Parameters: Applications, End when dismissed (end of event at notification dismissal), Permanent run, Duration (event run duration).
This sensor will start an event by application in foreground. Parameters: Applications.

This sensor will start an event by device orientation. Parameters: Display (Up, down), Sides (Horizontal, side up), Distance (Near, far; used is proximity sensor), Ignore for applications (in foreground).
This sensor will start an event by NFC tags. Parameters: NFC tags, Permanent run, Duration (event run duration).
Click this or swipe left-to-right to open \"Views\" side panel, where you can switch between Profiles and Events views.
Click this to open Application menu, where you can change application Settings.
Click this to restart events. You must restart events if you have a manually activated profile.
Click this to open activity log. Items logged are activities about start/pause/stop events, profile activations, applications started, etc.
Click this to add a new profile.
Click this to delete all profiles.
Click this to show Important information. Please read.
Click this to add a new event.
Click this to delete all events.
Click this to open the profile preferences editor.
Click this to open profile menu with options: Activate, Duplicate and Delete profile.
Drag profile up/down with this handler to change the profile view order in Activator.
Click this to open the event preferences editor.
Click this to open event menu with options: Enable/Stop run, Duplicate and Delete event.
Drag event up/down with this handler to change the event \"Start order\".
Click this to open Editor, where you can configure profiles, events, change application settings, etc.
Click this to open Editor, where you can configure profiles, change application settings, etc.
Click this to activate a profile.
Click this to save profile preference changes.
Click this to save event preference changes.
This profile will activate when no event is running.
This is used only for manual profile activation.
Provides support for some PhoneProfiles actions
Disabling this may cause some profiles and events parameters to malfunction.
Disabling this may cause some profiles and events parameters to malfunction.
(S) Use Device administrator (unlocking via fingerprint may not work)
Enable \"PhoneProfiles\" in Device administrator; for Lock method \"Use Device administrator\".
This sensor will start an event by switching radios (on/off). Parameters: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Mobile data, GPS, NFC, Airplane mode.
State of all radios must be fulfilled to start event. Configure only those radios that you need.
Use this if volume link detection is wrong.
Status bar notification is not enabled!
\"Do not disturb\" in profile \"Ringer mode\" requires enabling PhoneProfiles in \"Notification access\" system settings. Click here and enable.
In Android 6: This system setting can be changed only on rooted devices. Affected are ringer modes and do not disturb types with vibration.
Parameter profile_name is missing or empty.
Parameter event_name is missing or empty.
Your device does not have linked volumes for ringtone and notifications.
Some profile preferences require permission WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS. ROOT is not required. These preferences are marked with \"(G1)\".
For more informations look at \"Important information\", section \"Profiles\".
You can grant permission for PhoneProfiles required for profile parameters marked with (GX). This requires PC with installed adb.
If you do not have installed adb in PC:
1. In phone, go to Settings > About phone > Software Information and click on Build Number 10 times, you will now have a Developer Optioins entry in Settings.
2. In phone, go to Settings > Developer Options and enable USB Debugging.
3. In PC, start CMD (Windows), Terminal (Linux, OSX), go to folder In which adb is installed and start this command:
4. After successful execution, all profile parameters with (G1) mark will be enabled.
